p: The endocannabinoid system (ECS) is a complex cell-signaling system found in the human body which plays a regulatory role with respect to key human functions such as memory, appetite, homeostasis, and reproduction [ 117, 126]. The ECS is made up of some key biological molecules or structures. These are the endocannabinoids (lipid-based neurotransmitters), the cannabinoid receptors and their endogenous ligands, and the enzymes mediating the synthesis and the degradation of the endocannabinoid molecules.
